title: SBA names Newtown Savings Bank as Lender of the Quarter
title_page: SBA names Newtown Savings Bank as Lender of the Quarter
maintext:
The Small Business Association announced Newtown Savings Bank as its Lender of the Quarter, for the first quarter of fiscal 2018. From Oct. 1 to Dec. 31, 2017, Newtown Savings Bank had nine SBA loan approvals for the quarter, making them the fifth-most active lender in Connecticut out of 38 lenders. The bank’s SBA lending performance for the quarter has surpassed all the loan approvals they had for their entire lending activity for fiscal year 2017, in which they had seven loan approvals for the whole year.
“The bank’s rank within the top 10 SBA lenders in Connecticut together with nine SBA loan approvals this past quarter demonstrates a strong commitment to the small business community,” said Anne Hunt, SBA Connecticut District Director.
Anthony Giobbi, executive vice president and chief banking officer with Newtown Savings Bank added: “The Bank has made a commitment to expand our SBA lending capabilities as another way of serving the needs of our small business community. The SBA Lender of the Quarter recognition represents a shot in the arm to our SBA Lending team. We are pleased to see the first fruits of their efforts to provide this important financing alternative to our small business clients.”
The SBA offers a variety of loan guaranty programs including 7(a), SBA Express, and 504 Loans. SBA loans are guaranteed up to $5 million and are available for most business purposes, such as purchasing commercial real estate, equipment and inventory, or for providing short-term working capital. For more information about SBA, visit us at www.sba.gov/ct.
